newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran launches zinc sheets plant.
newsitem.headline: Iran launches zinc sheets plant.

text.p: Iran on Saturday launched a factory to produce 7,000 tonnes of zinc sheets a year in the northwestern province of Zanjan, the Iranian news agency said.
Iranian President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani inaugurated the factory built by Iranian experts at a cheaper price than the over $300 million that was demanded by foreigners, it said.

The zinc and lead plant in Angoran, 120 km (75 miles) southwest of the provincial capital Zanjan, was built at a total cost of 23 billion rials ($7.6 million) in addition to $750,000 in hard cash, it added.
Rafsanjani said the Angoran zinc mine had reserves worth over $7 billion.
The firm will launch an expansion plan worth six billion rials next year to double its annual output to 14,000 tonnes of zinc sheets, the agency said.
Iran, which ranks 10th in the world in zinc deposits, invested more than $3 billion in the Iranian year ending March 20, 1997, to boost annual zinc output to 6,500 tonnes.
